keywords.definition: keywords that describe the publication and its content

alb.definition: did the study inspect plots in the swabian alb / schwäbische alb exploratory?

sch.definition: did the study inspect plots in the Schorfheide-Chorin exploratory?

hai.definition: did the study inspect plots in the Hainich-Dün exploratory?

plot level.definition: what plot level did the study take place on? Grid plots (GP), experimental plots (EP), medium-intensive research plots (MIP), very-intensive research plots (VIP)

grassland.definition: did the study take place in grasslands?

forest.definition: did the study take place in forests?

aboveground.definition: did the study take place above the ground?

belowground.definition: did the study take place below the ground?

field.definition: did the study take place in the field?

laboratory.definition: did the study take place in a laboratory?

review.definition: is the study a review study?

infrastructure.definition: what infrastructure type of the Biodiversity Exploratories does the study belong to? Possible answers are: 'central coordination/local management', 'data management', 'instrumentation/remote sensing', 'inventory/campaign', 'synthesis', 'theory/modeling/methodological approaches', 'none'
infrastructure.raw_allowed: central coordination/local management', 'data management', 'instrumentation/remote sensing', 'inventory/campaign', 'synthesis', 'theory/modeling/methodological approaches', 'none'

biotic data taxon.definition: what taxa were investigated in the study?  Possible answers are: 'animals-invertebrates', 'animals-vertebrates', 'fungi', 'microbes', 'plants', 'none'

biotic data type.definition: what types of biotic data were investigated in the study? Possible answers are: 'single species', 'multiple species', 'genetic', 'total abundance', 'none'

processes and services.definition: what biological processes or services does the study cover? Possible answers are: 'biogeochemical cycle', 'decomposition', 'productivity', 'herbivory', 'pollination', 'predation/parasitism', 'dispersal', 'none'

environmental descriptors.definition: what environmental descriptors can be used to describe the study? Possible answers are: 'managed land use', 'unmanaged land use', 'soil', 'climate', 'none'

REX1.definition: does the study belong to the reduced land use experiment 1 (REX1)?

REX2.definition: does the study belong to the reduced land use experiment 2 (REX2)?

LUX.definition: does the study belong to the land use experiment (LUX)?

FOX.definition: does the study belong to the forest gap experiment  (FOX)?
